content.description: This one gets fun points for sure!   Start sitting under the middle of a steep wall.   Pull up in to a big undercling with fun footwork make a big reach to the lip on slopy holds. Get situated find a better hold and pull the mantel. There is a nice crack hold as you pull the last move.
content.location: The middle of the hill side area look for a 10 ft high cliff steep and smooth on one side and chunky on the right. This one climbs the middle of the left side.

content.description: The farthest left usable rock forms a corner with a big loose block on one wall that looks a bit spooky to stand under. this line climbs left of the corner on a slightly dirty looking but fun wall with interesting holds. Sit start low and tech your way up. fun moves all the way.
content.location: All the way left on the hill look for the corner and the loose block...

content.description:
This is another collection of mini-cliffs and boulders that might be worth while for southern NH climbers that dont want to drive far. Not much developed yet but there are a few nice lines, mostly on the moderate side. I will post things as they develope, or if you head up there please post what problems you clean and send. There might be 15 or 20 lines total, not a big area but hey, its southern NH what do you want! 

  The rock is on the east side of Yacum hill off rt 114 in goffstown. Check it out on a map before heading out cause there is a little bush whack to be had.
